newsitem.title: IRAN: Two strong Iran quakes kill three.
newsitem.headline: Two strong Iran quakes kill three.

text.p: Two strong earthquakes killed three people and injured 10 on Tuesday in northeastern Iran, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said.

It said the quakes, one registering 5.4 on the Richter scale and the other registering 6.1, occured near Esfarayen and Bojnourd, about 580 km (360 miles) northeast of Tehran, at 1:24 p.m. local time (0954 GMT) and 45 minutes later.
"Informed sources at the local medicare network told IRNA...three people have so far been killed and 10 others injured as a result of the natural disaster," the agency said.
"However the sources disclosed that the death toll is expected to rise," it said.
A tremor of force six can cause widespread damage and those of force five are powerful enough to cause heavy damage in a populated area.
